Personal Profile

I am a physics PhD candidate and self-taught front-end developer with a true passion for javascript. In parallel with the PhD course, which I will finish in May 2018, I have been developing the necessary skills to make a career out of programming and this strong interest led me to a scholarship given by Google to do their mobile web specialist certification (planed to the end of 2018).

Work Experience

Front-end Developer - Free lance jobs

Present

As self-taught developer, I started transforming websites mock-ups into real code (all of these displayed on my github repositories). At the moment I am developing my online identity, exploring React.js and participating in the google developer challenge.

LMU PhD student

January 2014 - May 2018

Along the PhD, I have published three scientific articles in high impact factor magazines mostly about astronomy and theoretical mathematical models. Data analysis, plotting and public speaking were main skills improved along this work.

Education

Google Developer Nanodegree Scholarship

Specialization course

The scholarship was divided in three steps: first a candidates selection, followed by three courses about progressive web applications. The students which completed the courses and had a remarkable contribution to the community, were selected to a nanodegree course through the Udacity platform. After the nanodegree, one may apply to the Google mobile web specialist certification, which I am planing to do in the end of 2018.

Ludwig-Maximilians-Universität München

PhD

The main focus of a PhD course is to transform a master of science into a researcher capable of producing a complete study from scratch until a relevant publication. I have learned and improved many skills along this conversion, as for example: programming, team work and task automation.

National Observatory of Rio de Janeiro

Master

During the master course, I had my first contact with the different tools used in scientific research. I significantly improved my knowledge of linux, English writing and started to use only VIM as editor, for which I still loyal.
